# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure. Here is your function:
```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(replace(replace(lowercase(col), " ", "_"), "-", "_"), "__", "_")
end
```
You can use this function like so:
```julia
column = " My Column  "
cleaned_column = clean_column(column)
println("Cleaned column name is : ", cleaned_column)
```
This would output:
```julia
Cleaned column name is : my_column
```
